Comments_List: Certainly learned a lot about a project I had no idea existed, the health impact fund, and in so doing, developed insight into the realities of the patent regime, pharmaceutical firms, and global health issues. Developed lots of mental skills to find loopholes and challenge the status quo.

Strength would certainly be accessibility and reasonableness. The readings are manageable and the course expectations clear. A weakness would be a lack of direction to the seminar discussions at the beginning of the semester. I think towards the middle of the term, discussions became more intentional and full, but it took a while for the class to take off as such.

This course is one where you get precisely what you put in. If students are willing to do readings fully or even supplement them, I think it would be an interesting endeavor. However, if you are someone who gets frustrated with lack of firm direction and lesson plan, this may not be the class for you.
